thread.title: New Kardashian Twitter tempest twirls after mag calls them 'First Family'
thread.title_full: New Kardashian Twitter tempest twirls after mag calls them 'First Family'

title: New Kardashian Twitter tempest twirls after mag calls them 'First Family'
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest New Kardashian Twitter tempest twirls after mag calls them 'First Family' The Kardashians sprawl on 'Cosmopolitan' cover as 'America's First Family,' outraging some who see it as a dis of the real First Family. Post to Facebook New Kardashian Twitter tempest twirls after mag calls them 'First Family' The Kardashians sprawl on 'Cosmopolitan' cover as 'America's First Family,' outraging some who see it as a dis of the real First Family. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1Led7pR Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 8 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs New Kardashian Twitter tempest twirls after mag calls them 'First Family' Maria Puente , USA TODAY 1:32 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 The Kardashians on 'Cosmopolitan' November cover. (Photo: Francesco Carrozzini/Cosmopolitan) 7 CONNECT 47 TWEET LINKEDIN 8 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Move over, Obamas in the White House; there's another "First Family" taking up space in America's cultural landscape and their names start with K. 
The Kardashians sprawl across Cosmopolitan magazine's November cover under the headline "America's First Family," causing outrage on Twitter and among editors of black-oriented media and websites. 
But the magazine, celebrating its 50th anniversary, says calm down: The cover is just a "teasing" way to describe the Kardashians as the "huge cultural phenomenon" that they are. 
And anyway, if Kim Kardashian's husband, Kanye West, succeeds in his quest to add POTUS to his resume, who knows? A photo posted by Cosmopolitan (@cosmopolitan) on Oct 4, 2015 at 6:16pm PDT 
The cover, featuring Kim, Khloe and Kourtney Kardashian with Kris, Kylie and Kendall Jenner, all wearing white shirts, promises "16 Pages! Like You've Never Seen Them Before" inside. 
The Kardashians were tweeting and Instagraming their delight about the cover. Happy 50th Birthday @cosmopolitan So excited to be on the November cover with my family!!!! ðŸ“· @francescocarrozzini pic.twitter.com/8WN2K1DC3J â€” Kim Kardashian West (@KimKardashian) October 5, 2015 
But to some on Twitter, the cover seemed to be deliberate belittling of the real First Family â€” the nation's first African-American First Family: President Obama, first lady Michelle Obama, and their daughters Malia and Sasha. @Cosmopolitan Shame on you for that Kardashian first family crap. You people need to get a clue. â€” Tahirah A-Williams (@takbarwi) October 5, 2015 Sorry Cosmo, there's only one First Family of America & it ain't the Kardashians. #CosmoFail pic.twitter.com/Su7p51ylqN â€” Eric Wolfson (@EricWolfson) October 5, 2015 I am not a fan of the Obamas in any way, but shame on @Cosmopolitan for calling the Kardashians the "first family." #classless
